hypothesis_content.title: Funding Rate Extremes with Spot-Vol Divergence for Stress Detection
hypothesis_content.statement: When perpetual funding rates exceed ±0.05% (annualized 18%) while 7-day realized volatility remains below 40% (annualized) and spot volume declines >20% from 30-day average, the market has 70% probability of entering STRESS regime within 3 days if price breaks key support/resistance.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extreme funding with low vol and declining volume indicates leveraged positioning extremes without spot conviction. A price break then triggers liquidations and volatility explosion characteristic of stress regimes.
entry_conditions: Price breaks below 20-day low (for negative funding) or above 20-day high (for positive funding)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to STRESS or 5 days elapse
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Funding normalizes to within ±0.02% before price break

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price breaks with these conditions lead to STRESS regime <50% of the time, or volatility increases without regime change.
